meaningMnemonic: When you <kanji>obtain</kanji> something acting like that person had <kanji>die</kanji>d, it's called <vocabulary>confiscation</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>forfeiture</vocabulary>. Maybe if they were alive, you think, they wouldn't have let me take it. Well they are still alive so it's theirs and you can't keep it forever.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
